formattedAddress: 74 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 74 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10012-2410, USA

editorialSummary.text: Australian-inspired cafe & bar serving all-day breakfast & brunch dishes in a casual space.

originalText.text: The banana walnut cake with espresso mascarpone was amazing! It is really big, so we had one seasonal toast(eggplant, toast, egg) plus egg on the side for main. The portion was enough for two, and we paid around $24 each. There are many people around lunch time, so recommend to make a reservation. The place was clean and cute, and they had bathroom.

text.text: The banana walnut cake with espresso mascarpone was amazing! It is really big, so we had one seasonal toast(eggplant, toast, egg) plus egg on the side for main. The portion was enough for two, and we paid around $24 each. There are many people around lunch time, so recommend to make a reservation. The place was clean and cute, and they had bathroom.

originalText.text: Great place to grab a bright and fresh bite of food and coffee. The restaurant is small but my friend and I had a table in the back and were comfortable and felt tucked away. Service was great and when they ran out of mushrooms on the miso mushroom bowl, they offered great substitutes. The highly talked about banana bread was incredibly dry but the espresso mascarpone made it worth it.

text.text: Great place to grab a bright and fresh bite of food and coffee. The restaurant is small but my friend and I had a table in the back and were comfortable and felt tucked away. Service was great and when they ran out of mushrooms on the miso mushroom bowl, they offered great substitutes. The highly talked about banana bread was incredibly dry but the espresso mascarpone made it worth it.

originalText.text:
Good place for brunch/breakfast. Cozy ambience, and friendly service.

I am not sure if the menu is the same across Two Hands locations. Scrambled egg with okra was a highlight of the savory brunch we ordered at the Bleecker street location.
Eggs Benedict was good, except for the too salty salmon on the side.

Don't forget to try their banana bread with walnut cream. It is entirely worth every calorie! Two Hands' barista knows their coffees, and all the coffees we tried here were up to the mark.

Slightly disappointing piece of our experience was where we were seated - right by the washroom. Patrons using the washroom consistently disrupted our flow of conversation, and we had to adjust our chairs a little every time the door was opened and shut. So, I'd recommend reserving a table beforehand!

All in all, a good place to hang out and have your meal in a relaxed atmosphere.

originalText.text: We took a weekend getaway from Texas and on Saturday as I was looking for places for a breakfast spot a picture of this delicious looking plate kept popping up so we made the walk from MSG area. Upon arrival we were told they had no tables available but if we knew what we wanted we could  take one of the reserved ones so long as we were done in less than an hour. We took it since we knew exactly what we wanted only for the waitress to comeback and tell us they didn't have the ingredients for the dish we wanted so we settled on something else and luckily it was very good. Still wished we had what we went there for but it was the weekend special and by 8:30 am they didn't have it.

originalText.text: This place has been my go-to lunch spot for a while. Everyone is always so nice, the food is always fresh, looks great and tastes great. Prices for drinks are pretty reasonable considering where you are. Meals are a bit pricy but they are worth what you pay for. Highly recommend it.
